Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: remove item from comparable array: :I'm very new to java and my first question is what is this Comparable thing? and in my sample code, why Class Bag<T extends Comparable<T>>?? What's the purpose?My second question is how to remove an item from this Comparable array. I have wrote the removeMin method, I have found the item, I named the variable "min", how do I go on and remove this min item from the arrayList? Thanks a lot!Here's some partial code:public class Bag<T extends Comparable<T>> implements Iterable<T> {    private int MAX_ITEMS = 10; // initial array size    private int size;    private Comparable[] data;    public Bag( ) {        //data = (Comparable []) new Object[MAX_ITEMS];        data = (T []) new Comparable[MAX_ITEMS];        size = 0;    }      public Comparable removeMin(){          Iterator<T> iterator=iterator();          T min = iterator.next();          while (iterator.hasNext())          {               T next = iterator.next();             if (min.compareTo(next) > 0)                 min = next;                ****************************************************                How to remove this min item?                 ****************************************************                }          return min;          }
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

Question: How to remove an item from an array in Java?
Please using this api: ArrayList.remove.
Answer:<<<api>>>: ArrayList.remove
<<<code>>>: data.remove(min);
<<<explanation>>>: Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from this list, if it is present. If this list does not contain the element, it is unchanged.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.


A: The Comparable interface in Java is used to order objects of a user-defined class. It has a single method compareTo() that is used to compare the current object with the specified object.

In your Bag class, you are using Comparable to order the elements in the Bag. The removeMin method finds the minimum element in the Bag by comparing each element to the current minimum.

To remove the minimum element from the Bag, you can use the ArrayList's remove method. Here is how you can do it:

```java
data.remove(min);
```

This will remove the first occurrence of the element 'min' from the ArrayList 'data'.

Please note that the ArrayList's remove method removes the element at the specified position in this list. The elements to the right of the specified position are shifted down to fill the gap.

Also, you need to ensure that the 'min' variable is of type Comparable and not of type T. If 'min' is of type T, you can cast it to Comparable before removing it from the ArrayList:

```java
data.remove((Comparable) min);
```

This will remove the first occurrence of the element 'min' from the ArrayList 'data'.

Please note that casting to Comparable is necessary because the ArrayList's remove method is defined to take an Object as its argument. If 'min' is of type T, it will not match the type expected by the remove method.

I hope this helps. Let me know if you have any other questions.
